Methods

CreateOrUpdate(RequestContent, RequestContext)

Creates or Updates a classification rule.

Declaration
public virtual Azure.Response CreateOrUpdate (Azure.Core.RequestContent content, Azure.RequestContext context = default);
Parameters
Azure.Core.RequestContent content

The content to send as the body of the request.
Azure.RequestContext context

The request context, which can override default behaviors on the request on a per-call basis.
Returns
Azure.Response

Remarks

Schema for Request Body:

{
  id: string,
  name: string,
  kind: "System" | "Custom" (required)
}

Schema for Response Body:

{
  id: string,
  name: string,
  kind: "System" | "Custom"
}

Schema for Response Error:

{
  error: {
    code: string,
    message: string,
    target: string,
    details: [
      {
        code: string,
        message: string,
        target: string,
        details: [ErrorModel]
      }
    ]
  }
}
Examples

This sample shows how to call CreateOrUpdate with required request content and parse the result.


var credential = new DefaultAzureCredential();
var endpoint = new Uri("<https://my-account-name.azure.com>");
var client = new PurviewScanningServiceClient(endpoint, credential).GetPurviewClassificationRuleClient("<classificationRuleName>");

var data = new {
    kind = "<System>",
};

Response response = client.CreateOrUpdate(RequestContent.Create(data));
JsonElement result = JsonDocument.Parse(GetContentFromResponse(response)).RootElement;
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("id").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("name").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("kind").ToString());

CreateOrUpdateAsync(RequestContent, RequestContext)

Creates or Updates a classification rule.

Declaration
[[System.Diagnostics.DebuggerStepThrough]]
public virtual System.Threading.Tasks.Task<Azure.Response> CreateOrUpdateAsync (Azure.Core.RequestContent content, Azure.RequestContext context = default);
Parameters
Azure.Core.RequestContent content

The content to send as the body of the request.
Azure.RequestContext context

The request context, which can override default behaviors on the request on a per-call basis.
Returns
System.Threading.Tasks.Task<Azure.Response>

Remarks

Schema for Request Body:

{
  id: string,
  name: string,
  kind: "System" | "Custom" (required)
}

Schema for Response Body:

{
  id: string,
  name: string,
  kind: "System" | "Custom"
}

Schema for Response Error:

{
  error: {
    code: string,
    message: string,
    target: string,
    details: [
      {
        code: string,
        message: string,
        target: string,
        details: [ErrorModel]
      }
    ]
  }
}
Examples

This sample shows how to call CreateOrUpdateAsync with required request content and parse the result.


var credential = new DefaultAzureCredential();
var endpoint = new Uri("<https://my-account-name.azure.com>");
var client = new PurviewScanningServiceClient(endpoint, credential).GetPurviewClassificationRuleClient("<classificationRuleName>");

var data = new {
    kind = "<System>",
};

Response response = await client.CreateOrUpdateAsync(RequestContent.Create(data));
JsonElement result = JsonDocument.Parse(GetContentFromResponse(response)).RootElement;
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("id").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("name").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("kind").ToString());

GetVersions(RequestContext)

Lists the rule versions of a classification rule.

Declaration
public virtual Azure.Pageable<BinaryData> GetVersions (Azure.RequestContext context = default);
Parameters
Azure.RequestContext context

The request context, which can override default behaviors on the request on a per-call basis.
Returns
Azure.Pageable<System.BinaryData>

Remarks

Schema for Response Body:

{
  value: [
    {
      id: string,
      name: string,
      kind: "System" | "Custom"
    }
  ],
  nextLink: string,
  count: number
}

Schema for Response Error:

{
  error: {
    code: string,
    message: string,
    target: string,
    details: [
      {
        code: string,
        message: string,
        target: string,
        details: [ErrorModel]
      }
    ]
  }
}
Examples

This sample shows how to call GetVersions and parse the result.


var credential = new DefaultAzureCredential();
var endpoint = new Uri("<https://my-account-name.azure.com>");
var client = new PurviewScanningServiceClient(endpoint, credential).GetPurviewClassificationRuleClient("<classificationRuleName>");

Response response = client.GetVersions();
JsonElement result = JsonDocument.Parse(GetContentFromResponse(response)).RootElement;
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("value").Item[0].GetProperty("id").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("value").Item[0].GetProperty("name").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("value").Item[0].GetProperty("kind").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("nextLink").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("count").ToString());

This sample shows how to call GetVersionsAsync and parse the result.


var credential = new DefaultAzureCredential();
var endpoint = new Uri("<https://my-account-name.azure.com>");

Response response = await client.GetVersionsAsync();

Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("value").Item[0].GetProperty("id").ToString());

TagVersion(Int32, String, RequestContext)

Sets Classification Action on a specific classification rule version.

Declaration
public virtual Azure.Response TagVersion (int classificationRuleVersion, string action, Azure.RequestContext context = default);
Parameters
System.Int32 classificationRuleVersion

The Integer to use.
System.String action

The ClassificationAction to use. Allowed values: "Keep" | "Delete".
Azure.RequestContext context

The request context, which can override default behaviors on the request on a per-call basis.
Returns
Azure.Response

Remarks

Schema for Response Body:

{
  scanResultId: OperationResponseScanResultId,
  startTime: string (ISO 8601 Format),
  endTime: string (ISO 8601 Format),
  status: "Accepted" | "InProgress" | "TransientFailure" | "Succeeded" | "Failed" | "Canceled",
  error: {
    code: string,
    message: string,
    target: string,
    details: [
      {
        code: string,
        message: string,
        target: string,
        details: [ErrorInfo]
      }
    ]
  }
}

Schema for Response Error:

{
  error: {
    code: string,
    message: string,
    target: string,
    details: [
      {
        code: string,
        message: string,
        target: string,
        details: [ErrorModel]
      }
    ]
  }
}
Examples

This sample shows how to call TagVersion with required parameters and parse the result.


var credential = new DefaultAzureCredential();
var endpoint = new Uri("<https://my-account-name.azure.com>");
var client = new PurviewScanningServiceClient(endpoint, credential).GetPurviewClassificationRuleClient("<classificationRuleName>");

Response response = client.TagVersion(1234, "<action>");
JsonElement result = JsonDocument.Parse(GetContentFromResponse(response)).RootElement;
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("scanResultId").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("startTime").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("endTime").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("status").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("error").GetProperty("code").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("error").GetProperty("message").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("error").GetProperty("target").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("error").GetProperty("details").Item[0].GetProperty("code").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("error").GetProperty("details").Item[0].GetProperty("message").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("error").GetProperty("details").Item[0].GetProperty("target").ToString());
Exceptions
System.ArgumentNullException

action is null.

TagVersionAsync(Int32, String, RequestContext)

Sets Classification Action on a specific classification rule version.

Declaration
[[System.Diagnostics.DebuggerStepThrough]]
public virtual System.Threading.Tasks.Task<Azure.Response> TagVersionAsync (int classificationRuleVersion, string action, Azure.RequestContext context = default);
Parameters
System.Int32 classificationRuleVersion

The Integer to use.
System.String action

The ClassificationAction to use. Allowed values: "Keep" | "Delete".
Azure.RequestContext context

The request context, which can override default behaviors on the request on a per-call basis.
Returns
System.Threading.Tasks.Task<Azure.Response>

Remarks

Schema for Response Body:

{
  scanResultId: OperationResponseScanResultId,
  startTime: string (ISO 8601 Format),
  endTime: string (ISO 8601 Format),
  status: "Accepted" | "InProgress" | "TransientFailure" | "Succeeded" | "Failed" | "Canceled",
  error: {
    code: string,
    message: string,
    target: string,
    details: [
      {
        code: string,
        message: string,
        target: string,
        details: [ErrorInfo]
      }
    ]
  }
}

Schema for Response Error:

{
  error: {
    code: string,
    message: string,
    target: string,
    details: [
      {
        code: string,
        message: string,
        target: string,
        details: [ErrorModel]
      }
    ]
  }
}
Examples

This sample shows how to call TagVersionAsync with required parameters and parse the result.


var credential = new DefaultAzureCredential();
var endpoint = new Uri("<https://my-account-name.azure.com>");
var client = new PurviewScanningServiceClient(endpoint, credential).GetPurviewClassificationRuleClient("<classificationRuleName>");

Response response = await client.TagVersionAsync(1234, "<action>");
JsonElement result = JsonDocument.Parse(GetContentFromResponse(response)).RootElement;
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("scanResultId").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("startTime").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("endTime").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("status").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("error").GetProperty("code").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("error").GetProperty("message").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("error").GetProperty("target").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("error").GetProperty("details").Item[0].GetProperty("code").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("error").GetProperty("details").Item[0].GetProperty("message").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("error").GetProperty("details").Item[0].GetProperty("target").ToString());
